page.title: 05CROOK PEAK MENDIPS PART`2'
page.content: ON REACHING THE TOP OF THE SLOPE,IT IS WELL WORTH THE EFFORT TO MOUNT THE ROCKY OUTCROP WHICH FORMS THE SUMMIT OF THE HILL. FOR THOSE WHO TOOK THE HARSHER CLIMB TO THE SOUTH,THE ROCKS HAVE BEEN SPARSELY COVERED WITH GRASS,LEGUMES AND THE OCCASIONAL DWARFED GORSE.THERE IS LITTLE SOIL ON THIS SLOPE AS IT IS SWEPT BY WINDS WHICH CARRY AWAY MOST SOIL PARTICLES. THE PATH ON THE EAST HAS BEEN ON SPRINGY TURF AS THE SOIL HAS BUILT UP ON THE VALLEY SLOPES AND BOTTOM ALLOWING GRASS,BRACKEN AND EVEN A FEW DECIDUOUS TREES TO BECOME ESTABLISHED. FROM THE PEAK PATHS FOR THE RIDER OR WALKER LEAD TO COMPTON HILL,WAVERING DOWN AND THE EASTEN HILLS OF MENDIP.
